text: They very seldom let me lose my cool. They made me like I was Polly Perfect, which was ridiculous so that when I bump into kids on the street they'd say 'I wish my Mom were like you.'
author: Charlotte Rae

text: I usually travel with a lot of people, like my dad, mom and sisters.
author: Booboo Stewart

text: I'm a '70s mom, and my daughter is a '90s mom. I know a lot of women my age who are real computer freaks.
author: Florence Henderson

text: My mom was a professional fitness competitor, so I go into the gym with her. I train with my dad and mother. It's embarrassing, because she's really strong.
author: Booboo Stewart

text: Part of the reason that I moved to Los Angeles is that even though my mom introduced me to all kinds of music, I really wanted to work on having my own identify, on being who I am and doing what I do, and seeing how people responded.
author: Schuyler Fisk
